result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L. Fanelli

records.addlTxt: At the request of Attorney Moore the STC of 11/10/22 at 9:30 has been reset to 12/05/22 at 1:30
At the request of Attorney Moore the STC of 10/21/22 at 9:00am has been reset to 11/10/22 at 9:30.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Moore.   Clerk. M.Burke. DE is on a PO hold and told Attorney Moore they are waiting for a treatment bed to open. Court quashes authorization to forfeit bond and does not issue bench warrant. State is waiting for lab test results. STC set to 10/21/22 at 9:00.
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney Moore appeared on behalf of the DE who did not appear.   Clerk. M.Burke. Court forfeits bond and issues $5,000. Stayed until 07/25/22 at 5:00.
Due to the ongoing trial in br 2 the STC on 06/17/22 at 10:30 has been adjourned by the court to 07/07/22 at 1:30.
Copy of email from Edward Hartnell/KCJ
Due to an ongoing trial in br 2 the STC on 05/04/22 at 10:30 is rescheduled with Atty Moore to 06/17/22 at 10:30.
from DOC Agt Ryan Gerhartz - update/notification of arrest.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob L. Fanelli; provided by Atty Moore in court.
Current: 3905 88th St, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 03-23-2022)
Prior: 1000 55th Street, c/o KenoshaCounty Jail, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States

***Amended to signature bond effective effective 3/29/22.***
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Katie A. - contact with her in a theraputic setting only and Jon L.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant in custody by zoom w/ Attorney A Moore. Clerk/H. Barnett. Continued bond motion. Atty Moore submits a plan from DOC for deft to go into the Vivitrol program on 3/29. Court amends bond to a signature bond effective 3/29/22; conditions remain as previously set.

Submitted by DOC
re:  treatment update

Minutes:  22CF123/22CF113/19CF1245.  Hybrid hrg.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody via Zoom.  Atty Adrienne Moore appeared in person on behalf of deft.  Defense counsel requests another status date; no objection by the State.  Status set for 5/4/22 @ 10:30am.  Defense counsel filed a bond motion.  Brief arguments heard.  Bond motion held in abeyance until 3/23/22 @ 8:30am.  Before Court will consider releasing the deft, the Court wants a plan in place that will monitor the deft.  NOTE - deft scheduled to be released to ES shortly.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob L. Fanelli
Current: 1000 55th Street, c/o KenoshaCounty Jail, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 02-08-2022)
Prior: 3905 88Th St, Kenosha, WI 53142
Status conference on March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Correspondence received from Atty Moore requesting to reschedule hearing on 2/9/22 and ADA Binger doesn not object.

Defendant Jacob L. Fanelli appeared with Attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE motion to dismiss case; arguments heard; Court denies motion.    ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Moore. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Branch 2 Scheduling Order given to attorney.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
To Dismiss
Submitted by Atty Adrienne Moore
